message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using substitution:

2x + 3y = 17

4x - 5y = -19
message_2:
First, we can solve the first equation for x in terms of y:

2x + 3y = 17

2x = 17 - 3y

x = (17 - 3y) / 2

Now, we can substitute this expression for x into the second equation:

4x - 5y = -19

4((17 - 3y) / 2) - 5y = -19

2(17 - 3y) - 5y = -19

34 - 6y - 5y = -19

-11y = -53

y = 53 / 11

Now that we have the value of y, we can substitute it back into the expression for x:

x = (17 - 3y) / 2

x = (17 - 3(53 / 11)) / 2

x = (17 - 159 / 11) / 2

x = (28 / 11) / 2

x = 14 / 11

So the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 14/11 and y = 53/11.
